Expectation1: Ensuring financial stability for the family
Situation1: A home loan repayment is due in two months, and the parent needs to prepare for it
Situation2: They encounter a situation where a friend is being treated unfairly and feel a stronger responsibility to intervene or speak up.
Story: I sat at the kitchen table, bills spread out before me, the weight of the home loan repayment looming over my thoughts. As a parent, I knew my family depended on me to keep us afloat, to make sure we never missed a payment, never risked our home. Every rupee counted, and I had been working extra hours, cutting corners wherever I could. But today, at work, I saw something that gnawed at my conscience—a close friend was being blamed for a mistake he didn’t make, and the management was ready to fire him. As a Hindu, I was taught to stand up for dharma, to speak the truth and protect the innocent, even if it meant personal risk. But if I spoke up, I might anger my boss, jeopardize my job, and put my family’s financial security in danger. My heart pounded as I weighed my duty as a parent against my responsibility to uphold what is right. The two roles pulled me in opposite directions, and I sat there, paralyzed, unsure which path to choose.
